content.en: Tongue tracking: Researchers have been exploring the use of algorithms to study the movement and shape of the tongue. They have developed methods that use dynamic programming, matrix factorization, and other techniques to reconstruct 3D tongue surface motion, develop tongue models, analyze tongue motion, and track the tongue in ultrasound and MRI images. These algorithms have shown promise in accurately measuring tongue shapes and positions, identifying functional units of tongue behavior, and even identifying phoneme landmarks.
content.da: Tungesporing: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer til at studere tungens bevægelse og form. De har udviklet metoder, der bruger dynamisk programmering, matrixfaktorisering og andre teknikker til at rekonstruere 3D tungeroverfladebevægelse, udvikle tungemodeller, analysere tungens bevægelse og spore tungen i ultralyds- og MRI-billeder. Disse algoritmer har vist lovende resultater i præcist at måle tungens former og positioner, identificere funktionelle enheder af tungens adfærd og endda identificere fonemlandemærker.
